column4: Hey guys, Im having trouble connecting to a cisco vpn with ubuntu 9.04. Everytime i try to connect with the network manager it fails. Is there any way I can see an output or log somewhere so I can see exactly what fails? Thanks
it does use syslog .. so you'll probably find something in /var/log/syslog
or one of the other files in that directory.  I'd use something like this to find out.   sudo tail -f /var/log/*
thanks., ill look in the sys log file viewer
